channel.title: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Tensions In Ukraine Increase As Cease-Fire Appears To Have Dissolved
item.description: A week-old ceasefire in eastern Ukraine has all but broken down. Shelling that was previously constrained to the airport in Donetsk reached the city over the weekend.
item.content:encoded:
A week-old ceasefire in eastern Ukraine has all but broken down. Shelling that was previously constrained to the airport in Donetsk reached the city over the weekend.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Continued Killings Could Bolster Need For Action Against ISIS
item.description: The killing of British aid worker David Haines by the self-proclaimed Islamic State provoked international outrage and could bolster U.S. efforts to build support for an anti-ISIS coalition.
item.content:encoded:
The killing of British aid worker David Haines by the self-proclaimed Islamic State provoked international outrage and could bolster U.S. efforts to build support for an anti-ISIS coalition.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Alice Fordham

item.title: U.S. Says Allies In Middle East And Elsewhere Want To Help Fight ISIS
item.description: On a weekend that saw extremist group the Islamic State release a video showing the murder of a Western hostage, support for a coalition to fight the group is building.
item.content:encoded:
On a weekend that saw extremist group the Islamic State release a video showing the murder of a Western hostage, support for a coalition to fight the group is building.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Thousands Gather In Germany To Rally Against Anti-Semitism
item.description: At an event in Berlin, Chancellor Angela Merkel said there is no place for anti-Semitism in Germany and called it a "monstrous scandal" that anyone in the country would be hassled for being Jewish.
item.content:encoded:
At an event in Berlin, Chancellor Angela Merkel said there is no place for anti-Semitism in Germany and called it a "monstrous scandal" that anyone in the country would be hassled for being Jewish.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Soraya Sarhaddi Nelson

item.title: Cameron Condemns Execution Of British Aid Worker By ISIS
item.description: The Islamic State militant group released a video showing the execution of British aid worker David Haines. NPR's Lynn Neary talks with the BBC's Gordon Corera about the reaction in the U.K.
item.content:encoded:
The Islamic State militant group released a video showing the execution of British aid worker David Haines. NPR's Lynn Neary talks with the BBC's Gordon Corera about the reaction in the U.K.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Shelling In Donetsk Rocks Cease-Fire In Ukraine
item.description: The cease-fire in eastern Ukraine is being tested, with intense fighting reported near the airport in Donetsk Saturday and Sunday. An NPR team in that city was forced to flee the shelling.
item.content:encoded:
The cease-fire in eastern Ukraine is being tested, with intense fighting reported near the airport in Donetsk Saturday and Sunday. An NPR team in that city was forced to flee the shelling.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Estonia 'Spy' Dispute Could Be Russia Making Anti-NATO Mischief
item.description: It could be the next big spy movie: an Estonian intelligence agent nabbed by Russia on spy charges. Russia says he was spying on them; Estonia says he was kidnapped in a cross-border raid.
item.content:encoded:
It could be the next big spy movie: an Estonian intelligence agent nabbed by Russia on spy charges. Russia says he was spying on them; Estonia says he was kidnapped in a cross-border raid.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Corey Flintoff

item.title: U.S. Call To Fight Militants Stirs Bitter Memories For Iraq's Sunnis
item.description: President Obama wants Sunnis to join the battle against the Islamic State. But those who helped fight al-Qaida several years ago feel abused by the Iraqi military, and now are not so eager to sign up.
item.content:encoded:
President Obama wants Sunnis to join the battle against the Islamic State. But those who helped fight al-Qaida several years ago feel abused by the Iraqi military, and now are not so eager to sign up.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Alice Fordham

item.title: ISIS 'Are Not Muslims, They Are Monsters,' Cameron Says
item.description: This weekend, David Haines' family publicly asked his captors to contact them. Instead, the group released its third video showing a Western hostage being killed.
item.content:encoded:
This weekend, David Haines' family publicly asked his captors to contact them. Instead, the group released its third video showing a Western hostage being killed.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: North Korea Sentences American To Six Years Of Hard Labor
item.description: Matthew Miller, of Bakersfield, Calif., had entered North Korea on a tourist visa. The country says he sought to be thrown in jail to investigate human rights issues.
item.content:encoded:
Matthew Miller, of Bakersfield, Calif., had entered North Korea on a tourist visa. The country says he sought to be thrown in jail to investigate human rights issues.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Scottish Author: 'We Want Control Over Our Destiny'
item.description: Scotland's independence vote is just a few days away. NPR's Lynn Neary talks to the best-selling Scottish novelist Val McDermid about her thoughts on the referendum.
item.content:encoded:
Scotland's independence vote is just a few days away. NPR's Lynn Neary talks to the best-selling Scottish novelist Val McDermid about her thoughts on the referendum.

» E-Mail This

item.title: USAID Steps Up Building Of New Ebola Treatment Units
item.description: Dr. Rajiv Shah, head of the U.S. Agency for International Development, speaks with NPR's Lynn Neary about the organization's efforts to coordinate a worldwide response to the Ebola crisis.
item.content:encoded:
Dr. Rajiv Shah, head of the U.S. Agency for International Development, speaks with NPR's Lynn Neary about the organization's efforts to coordinate a worldwide response to the Ebola crisis.

» E-Mail This

item.title: As Floodwaters Recede In Kashmir Valley, Anger Grows
item.description: The floodwaters are receding in Indian-administered Kashmir, but the death toll continues to rise as authorities assess the destruction and seek disaster relief aid from the Indian government.
item.content:encoded:
The floodwaters are receding in Indian-administered Kashmir, but the death toll continues to rise as authorities assess the destruction and seek disaster relief aid from the Indian government.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Julie McCarthy

item.title: Will Obama's Plan Be Enough To Quell Islamic State?
item.description: Last week, President Obama laid out a plan to fight the Islamic State. NPR's Lynn Neary talks to David Rothkopf, CEO and editor of Foreign Policy magazine, about Obama's foreign policy strategy.
item.content:encoded:
Last week, President Obama laid out a plan to fight the Islamic State. NPR's Lynn Neary talks to David Rothkopf, CEO and editor of Foreign Policy magazine, about Obama's foreign policy strategy.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Islamic State Video Shows Execution Of British Aid Worker
item.description: The Islamic State militant group released a video showing the execution of British aid worker David Haines. NPR's Lynn Neary talks with NY Times reporter Steven Erlanger about the U.K. reaction.
item.content:encoded:
The Islamic State militant group released a video showing the execution of British aid worker David Haines. NPR's Lynn Neary talks with NY Times reporter Steven Erlanger about the U.K. reaction.
